text: Jean Ritchie (December 8, 1922 â€“ June 1, 2015) was an American folk music singer, songwriter, and Appalachian dulcimer player. Elektra records signed her and released three albums: Jean Ritchie Sings (1952), Songs of Her Kentucky Mountain Family (1957) and A Time for Singing (1962). Ritchie was born in Viper, Kentucky. Ritchie died in Berea, Kentucky, aged 92. ==Other websites== * Live 1976 recording of Ritchie performing "Nottamun Town" from the Florida Folklife Collection (made available for public use by the State Archives of Florida) * Photographs of Jean Ritchie while artist in residence at UC Santa Cruz in 1978, from the UC Santa Cruz Library's Digital Collections * Videos on Woodsongs Archive Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American folk singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Singers from Kentucky
title: Jean Ritchie
